Activity: Log in to the workstation and review the schedule for the day. Refresh memory on the agenda for the meeting with the clinical and health informatics team.
Prepare a concise presentation summarizing the proposed data quality metrics and the rationale behind them. Anticipate potential questions and prepare answers.

Meeting with @clinlead-1, @rn-1, @his-1 to discuss the proposed data quality metrics. Actively listen to their feedback and incorporate their suggestions into the metric definitions. Take detailed notes.
Update the data quality metric definitions based on the feedback received in the meeting. Document any changes made and the rationale for those changes.
Begin working on the methodology for calculating the data quality metrics. Define the specific SQL queries or scripts needed to extract the required data from the EHR system.
Lunch Break. Read some articles related to data analysis.
Continue developing the SQL queries for data extraction. Test the queries on a sample dataset to ensure they are accurate and efficient. Iterate as needed.

Contact @dba-1 to discuss access permissions for the EHR database and any potential performance issues related to running the data extraction queries. @PEOPLE: ['dba-1'] Topic: EHR Database Access and Performance Considerations
Refine the SQL queries based on feedback from @dba-1 and adjust for any database limitations or performance constraints.
Start drafting the initial weekly data quality report template. Incorporate the agreed-upon visualizations and data elements. Focus on clarity and conciseness.
Review the day's progress. Make a list of remaining tasks for the week.
